adrFormatAddress: 1623 1st Ave., New York, NY 10028-4304, USA

originalText.text: Dr Doloroso and her team have taken excellent care of our two cats.  On one occasion it was for tooth cleaning and, for one cat, tooth extractions.  Both cats came out of this very well.  On another we took in our cat on the advice of another vet for further teeth cleaning and after examination Dr Doloroso said he was fine for the present and did not take our money.  So we have both high respect and appreciation for her.  Thank you Dr Doloroso!

originalText.text:
I found them in a difficult situation with my cat of 9 years. He became very sick and they helped me treat him and keep him comfortable in his last months to have more time and I even thought he‚Äôd live, but when it was time to say, ‚Äúgoodbye‚Äù... they were great with us again.
I‚Äôve referred people to them and now that I‚Äôve just adopted a new kitten, I‚Äôll be bringing him here, as well as my older cat.

They really care about the well being of your pets, the prices are good and the staff is kind and respectful.

originalText.text: Brought my dog there when he had issues with his bowels and it was a great experience! The staff is friendly, and the vet was very helpful and kind towards my dog. She gave me great advice and even called back to check up on my dog 2 days later. Excellent service!

text.text: Brought my dog there when he had issues with his bowels and it was a great experience! The staff is friendly, and the vet was very helpful and kind towards my dog. She gave me great advice and even called back to check up on my dog 2 days later. Excellent service!

originalText.text: I used to live on the upper east side and after moving to Hamilton Heights, I wasn't able to find a vet I liked as Dr Lily. She saved my elderly cat's life when he became constipated. Now she treats both my cats!
